intro: Neanotis montholonii, commonly known as the Malagasy starflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its star-shaped, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its leaves are palmate, with five to seven lobes, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Neanotis montholonii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted geographic distribution.
